replies.bodyText:
Normally, I'd agree, and don't mind the idea of making more overloads. However, this is inteded to be plugin implemented, and as a group of methods that do the same thing with different conditions I opted to have a "master" method that has two nullable parameters.

If we want plugins to do as little as needed by using default methods, we're going to need to have a @Nullable source somewhere in one of the methods.
Alternatively, we just do away with default methods as this is a totally new interface, which I admit, I am tempted to do.

That said, I do need to alter the order of the parameters anyway. The "token" should come first, as that's the most important part of the call.

replies.bodyText: I'd do away with the default methods. That way we don't muddy the contract.

timeline.message:
Add a simplistic PlaceholderService

The intent behind such a service is to harmonise the various templating systems to use a common bank of placeholders. PlaceholderParsers will be registered centrally using the Sponge registry system such that there is a standard way for all plugins to get a placeholder, alonge with a standard way to include them in text constructions.

This service is replaceable, allowing for a plugin to support a superset of the required base. Other plugins can also just make sure of the parser registry if they wish.

Notably, this PR does NOT include a templating system. This is intentional, to allow plugins to provide their own systems as now.

Part of the ideas from #1891

timeline.message:
Remove the PlaceholderService, reduce to three objects.

Plugins register PlaceholderParsers, create Texts with PlaceholderContexts and, optionally, use a PlaceholderText in Text.of() constructs.

timeline.message:
Add simple Placeholder system

This enables plugins to register their own PlaceholderParsers to the Sponge registry, enabling plugins to provide and access placeholders without needing a third party plugin.

Notably, this PR does NOT include a templating system. This is intentional, to allow plugins to provide their own systems as now.

Part of the ideas from #1891
